Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff, is a very good place to sleep,”
Reviews.Author: Adkpridetravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before we left on our cruise, was a great location, the manager kept our luggage for us during the morning and early after noon before we disembarked on our cruise, very friendly staff, comfy beds, clean rooms, only bad thing was water in shower wasn't the warmest, but great price for night

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: kamorris
Reviews.Content: Other than the good location in Old San Juan this hotel has nothing to offer the traveler to Puerto Rico. It took 45 minutes to check-in. There were no working phones in the rooms. We had no hot water. The rooms were not only dark and dingy, but not very clean either. There was no coffee for the coffeemaker. The elevator did not work. Room security was questionable. Balconies could be accessed from neighboring rooms and several window locks did not work. The staff was friendly, but very inefficient. Stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: frombrooklyn
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience my husband and I have ever had. The check-in took an inordinate amount of time; they said someone would help me with my bags while my husband went to park the car - no one ever came. We dropped our stuff in the room quickly because we wanted to explore the Fortress, did not return until much later, exhausted. It wasn't until we returned that we realized we were in a room that must have been used for prostitution - since I found a half-empty liquor bottle, price tag for negligee, disposable razor in the bathroom.....Not to mention no phone, no remote. My husband was already asleep when I discovered all of this, so we stayed the night. What they called a "balcony" was just a metal rail outside the windows. The Plaza below was noisy all night and the trash removal truck came at 4:00 am with VERY LOUD commotion. When I told the front desk the next day what the situation was, they said "You weren't supposed to have that room" - that was it. I called Howard Johnson corporate when I returned to US Mainland and filed a complaint, but never got a response. It was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the worst hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Rajkumar J
Reviews.Content: Terrible, terrible hotel. Dark, windowless rooms with very noisy air conditioners. Broken toilets, shower doors that do not close completely. Unhelpful and rude reception staff who lack the basic skills on how to deal with customers. The only thing going for the hotel is the location by Plaza de Armas but Old San Juan is small and you are better off staying in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Away!”
Reviews.Author: airamboricua
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent area in the Old San Juan. The house is a very old structrure, very clean. We stayed in room 304 because we wanted a balcony. The room was very comfortable, enough space for my boyfriend & me. I only stay for one night, but next time I visit the area will definitelly stay longer. The price was right and if you compare it with other others in the area is exellent!. We didn't use the restaurant, since there were plenty of alternative around the hotel. In front of the hotel there is plaza with kiosk, taxi stop, a pharmacy and even a Marshall (just in case you forgot something at home). If you are taking a cruise from San Juan, this is a perfect hotel for before or after your cruise. The staff is not very friendly but we really didn't need anything from them. I think if you are looking for a luxury hotel and you are willing to pay the price for it, them you can stay in a different one. Old San Juan is a very old city and the structures are 100 of years old, you should not expect the same as when you visit Spain or any old country. My boyfriend and I felt very safe as we walked from shop to shop. Fabulous time!

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you Need to stay in old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Eva L
Reviews.Content: I have read many reviews about this hotel before deciding to stay here for one night before the cruise. The hotel is in a central location in old San Juan, I know I shouldn't expect much based on other reviews, but it was worse than I expected. There was no wait to check-in since we were the only guests in the lobby. The elevator didn't work, we had to drag our luggages all the way up four floors! The ice machine also didn't work. The front desk staff didn't seem to care, she was on the phone for a very very long time. If you have to stay in old San Juan, this hotel has the best location, be prepared to walk up and down the stairs, I have the impression that the elevator doesn;t work most of the time! The restaurant in the hotel( actually doesn't belong to the hotel) is about the only good thing beside the location of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting place!”
Reviews.Author: Julie V
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before our cruise (February 2008-sorry date list didn't include this date). At first I was concerned with the lack of windows, but it wasn't a problem. The room was clean, the staff friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast was plentiful and had a great assortment. The location was amazing! We often sat in the town square which is soooo close and drank coffee and people watched. We felt very safe as we walked from shop to shop. Fabulous time! Looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyekt13
Reviews.Content: When we made our trip to San Juan, we wanted to stay in the Old San Juan area, so this hotel was perfect for that. It has a great location and is in walking distance to everything on this side of the city. They do charge additional fees for every additional person in the room, so I would recommend just sending one person from your party in and then bringing whomever else up at different times to save a few bucks. The room was tiny with no windows, but we weren't in Puerto Rico to spend time in our hotel, we just needed a home base for our luggage, so this was perfect for that. If you actually intend on being in the hotel room or are on some sort of romantic vacation, then I would go to the tourist side of San Juan and stay in a resort, this is not that type of place, but was perfect for what we needed it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Problems problems problems”
Reviews.Author: jammex88
Reviews.Content: OK I understand you get what you pay for and overall the hotel is acceptable. However be prepared for one thing after another if you stay here. Just a few things: ELEVATOR literally looks like it is from the 19th century..taking your life in your hands using it. CUSTOMER SERVICE is bad, rude, indifferent for the most part. They screwed up some details of our reservation and then copped an attitude about it before relenting they had made the mistake. One day the room was not made up and even after we reported it they never cleaned the room that day. One lamp in the room did not work at all. The AC did not work for the first two days. The soap was not replaced in the bathroom for the entire stay. The TV remote did not work, on and on and on...good luck if you stay here. If you do, LOWER YOUR EXPECTATIONS.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: chantal016
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed in this hotel so we knew what to expect going in. This stay was absolutely the worst hotel experience I have ever had. The elevator was out of order so we had to carry our bags up the dimly lit, very tight stairs ourselves. There was no offer of help from the front desk. They even laughed when they said they hoped we had good muscles. Once we got to the room, the phone didn't work, the TV didn't work and we had absolutely no hot water. It wasn't even luke warm. It was ice cold. We also discovered that the safe didn't work. Since we had no way to call the front desk, my husband ended up having to make several trips up and down the stairs to get some of the issues resolved. The hotel was sold out so their only answer for the water problem was to offer us use of another room which was not being used because the front door often got stuck in the locked position trapping people inside the room. To which they once again laughed and said good luck. All in all, it was a horrible experience! We weren't expecting much since we had been there before but this was outrageous. Couldn't they hire a young baggage boy to assist customers with their baggage. Many customers are coming and going from cruise ships with luggage for 1-2 weeks. No offer of apology from the front desk staff, just laughs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: GloNashvilleTN
Reviews.Content: We staryed here 2 nights prior to our Carnival Cruise. The elevator was out of order. our room was on the 2nd floor and we had to drag our suitcases up two flights of stairs, and back down again. The phones did not work. There was hot water in the shower, but not in the sink. The mens restroom in the lobby was out of order and they had to use the women's. The rooms were small and barely enough room for our suitcases, and to walk around. We could only get 2 stations on the TV. There were no windows in the rooms. There was no coffee or continental breakfast. It was very noisy about midnight when some boistrous guests came in. Pros: The girls at the check in desk were super nice and friendly. It was a good location as we could walk to many places. The trolly was free in the whole town & you could get on and off whenever you wanted. We were charged $135 per night which was way overpriced for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and location”
Reviews.Author: deckhandoug
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel for the price, friendly staff. Lots to see and do pre cruise. Enjoyed our precruise stay, within walking distance of the cruise pier

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsFoodee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here an extra night after coming in from an 11 day cruise. Old San Juan is fantastic. We loved its charm and all there is to do. This hotel is an inexpensive option to be in the middle of it. We were able to walk to the El Moro forts as well as explore the areas shops, restaurants and waterfront views. There was a fantastic turkish restaurant we ate at for lunch although I dont remember the name of it. In the evenings, everything comes alive. The restaurants come outdoors and there is live music and a bustling crowd. Fantastic food and friendly locals. This hotel is old as is the city (the elevator is even the old timey cage ones - I thought it was neat) but clean and the staff was friendly. We would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: m1salas
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the worst after reading the reviews.....but since my expectations were low, I was pleasantly surprised when we checked in. Yes they made us wait until 3 pm to check in, Yes the elevator is slow, Yes the T.V did not work......but the location made up for the inconveniences. We stayed for one night before our cruise and are glad we picked a hotel that was in the middle of old san juan. We could easliy walk to both fortresses, enjoy a stroll around old san juan's shops and restaurants and even walk to the port with our luggage from this location. If you dont plan on spending too much time in your room (only because of lack of T.V) and want to enjoy old san juan at your leisure, this is a good place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Broken”
Reviews.Author: mack243SouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: The room we had included no windows, so we did have noiseless sleep. The coffee maker was broken and the toilet overflowed the first time we used it. The night manager came up to plunge it with some success. I attempted to take a picture of the room but it was too small to take a meaningful shot. Other things like the light next to the bed and tv remote were also broken. This hotel was a new low in terms of maintenance issues. They gave us a complementary muffin and coffee breakfast because of all the problems. The restaurant would be only for snacks. I heard from other travelers that there are other hotels nearby which cost about the same but had much better rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: Silverbee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our Carnival Victory cruise in January. The hotel is older, but then so is every building in Old San Juan. We found it a decent enough hotel for one night. Great location, starbucks is right across the plaza. We paid something like $125/night, which was a fair price. It is probably 5 or so blocks from the pier. We had no trouble dragging our luggage through the streets to the pier. Yes, there are some hotels closer to the pier, but they were more expensive. One thing I did not like was that on the confirmation is says there is a free continental breakfast included, and there wasn't. There is a small cafe at the front of the hotel, but we went to the front desk and asked where the complementary breakfast was and he said they did not have one. We walked around on the first floor and saw the signs for it and where it should have been, so this was disappointing. I did not push the issue further as I didn't want to start out our cruise this way, and we went to starbucks instead. The hotel will hold your luggage for you if need them to.

Reviews.Title: “Did not enjoy, thank go it was just one night.”
Reviews.Author: ZaZa1964
Reviews.Content: Would never stay there again. Hotel clean, lots of echo/noise, rooms look like student dorms, small 2 person ancient elevator where you need to close the "gate door" or else, elevator gets stucked on the floor and staff need to go close the door for it to work again, no parking near by. Non smoking HOTEL, asked for a 3rd pillow, they didn't have any.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyePete77
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had the WORST TIME at this hotel. Let me repeat myself...MY FRIENDS AND I HAD THE WORST TIME!!! I booked a room with a balcony, phone, fridge, and tv. The TV was the only thing which worked, the balcony was a false balcony, the fridge...didnt exist, and the phone didnt work. Hot water...didnt exist either, nor did the wi-fi. The staff didnt seem to care about our needs at all, but did offer us to move to another room so we could have a fridge, only this room didnt have a phone. The staff showed us how to break into our own rooms from the outside, and moved our gear to a new room without our permission. Its EXTREMELY easy to hear from your room everything that is yelled outside, and whoever drives by. The only positive thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good pre/post night cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: sb_enfrance
Reviews.Content: Hello, stayed at this hotel one night prior my cruise, wich was leaving for Old San Juan, and 3 nights after. Room good, but no windows except the suites. Just that if you come in during the weekend by taxi, well assume a long ride, because traffic in Old San Juan is no fun. maybe best to get off near the pear, and walk to the hotel, trust me , my cab driver was not very happy. For a affordable hotel in Old San Juan, it is a good choice
